How do psychological beliefs , such as values , feelings , and experiences , relate to the physical reality ? Philosophers who practice the philosophy of mind experience these questions from a variety of perspectives , including metaphysical , epistemological , and scientific . Some people argue that the mind is a purely real concept that can be fully explained by neuroscience and mind , while also argue that the mind is a pseudo - mental concept that cannot be limited to purely physical concepts . The mind of thought is closely connected to other branches of reasoning , including metaphysics ( the study of the essence of truth ) , epistemology ( the study of knowledge and belief ) , and philosophy ( the examination of moral principles and values ) . It is also well connected to the fields of psychology , neuroscience , and cognitive science , which study the origins of the mind and mental mechanisms from a science view .
